senselogic.sitevision.api.render

Interface ImageRenderer


  • @Requireable(value="ImageRenderer")
public interface ImageRenderer
    ImageRenderer is a stateful utility interface that can be used to render valid html img elements based on images of the website.

    ImageRenderer is very suitable when rendering more than one image or when you want to render images in different sizes than the original images (e.g. "thumbnails"). ImageRenderer also supports "hover" images, i.e. another image is displayed whenever the cursor hovers over the image.

    ImageRenderer has few attributes:

    • image - The image that should be rendered. Default is null.
    • hoverImage - The image that is displayed when the mouse cursor "hovers" (is over) the rendered image. Default is null.
    • style - The css style for the rendered element. Default is null. (though, the element class is always 'sv-noborder', which is equivalent with style 'border:none')
    • description - The image description. Default is null.
    • useAutoDescription - Whether to use a fallback strategy for getting an image description or not. If set to true and there are no description set, the renderer will try to get the description metadata for the image. Default is false.
    • useTitleRendering - Whether to render a title or not. The description will be used as value. Default is false.
    • useAutoTitle - Whether to use a fallback strategy for getting a title (if description is missing) or not. If set to true and there are no description available, the renderer will try to get the description metadata for the image. Default is false.
    • useEncoding - Whether to encode description, title, data-attributes and aria-attributes or not. Default is true.
    • sourceSetMode - The srcset attribute rendering strategy. Default is SourceSetMode.AUTO.
    • imageScaler - The ImageScaler used to create new images in other sizes than the original ones. Default is null.
    • useImageScaler - Whether to use an imageScaler (if present) or not. Default is true.
    • lazyLoad - If the image should be lazy loaded. Default is false.
    • dimensionMode - The width/height css style properties rendering strategy. Default is DimensionMode.AUTO.
    • cssClasses - Custom css class values. Default is null (no custom classes).
    • dataAttributes - Custom HTML5 data-x attributes and values. Default is null (no custom data attributes).
    • ariaAttributes - Custom HTML5 aria-x attributes and values. Default is null (no custom aria attributes).

    Using the ImageRenderer is pretty straightforward, if you remember that it is stateful and that the previously loaded image will be cleared whenever you try to load a new one. Conceptually you would typically use it like this:

    1. Get the ImageRenderer
    2. Possibly init the renderer with rendering settings (useEncoding, useAutoDescription, useTitleRendering, useAutoTitle, sourceSetMode)
    3. Possibly set a style
    4. Possibly set a hover image
    5. Possibly set an image scaler
    6. Set an image
    7. Possibly set an image description
    8. Do render

    When you have rendered once, you can re-use the ImageRenderer until you are done. Something like:

    1. Update the image
    2. Possibly set an image description
    3. Do render.

    Example of how this strategy could be implemented in Velocity:
    (You want to do a simple listing of some image nodes in a collection/iterator "$images", and for each image a thumbnail should be displayed on top of the original 

    
   ## Get an ImageScaler that scales images to size 200x100
   #set ($imageScaler = $sitevisionUtils.getImageScaler(200, 100))

   ## Get an ImageRenderer and apply the ImageScaler
   #set ($imageRenderer = $sitevisionUtils.imageRenderer)
   $imageRenderer.setImageScaler($imageScaler)
   $imageRenderer.clearSourceSetMode() ## Disable source set (to ensure it won't interfere with the scaled size)

   ## Iterate through images and render them
   <ul style="list-style:none">
   #foreach ($image in $images)
      ## Load an image
      $imageRenderer.update($image)

      <li>
         ## Render the thumbnail (ensure scaler is active)
         $imageRenderer.forceUseImageScaler()
         $imageRenderer.render()

         ## Render image (ensure scaler is inactive)
         $imageRenderer.clearUseImageScaler()
         $imageRenderer.render()
      </li>
   #end
   </ul>

    Since ImageRenderer is stateful and likely will be used in Velocity frequently, there are some "shortcuts" that might be useful. Due to the lack of proper boolean support in Velocity, the boolean attributes has corresponding force/clear methods to set the boolean to true/false. Due to the lack of proper null support in Velocity, some attributes has clear methods to set the attribute to null. For example:

    • Executing forceUseImageScaler() results in an execution of setUseImageScaler(true)
    • Executing clearUseImageScaler() results in an execution of setUseImageScaler(false)
    • Executing forceUseTitleRendering() results in an execution of setUseTitleRendering(true)
    • Executing clearUseTitleRendering() results in an execution of setUseTitleRendering(false)
    • Executing forceSourceSetMode() results in an execution of setSourceSetMode(SourceSetMode.ON)
    • Executing clearSourceSetMode() results in an execution of setSourceSetMode(SourceSetMode.OFF)
    • Executing clearHoverImage() results in an execution of setHoverImage(null)
    • Executing clearStyle() results in an execution of setStyle(null)
    • Executing forceUseLazyLoad() results in an execution of setLazyLoad(true)
    • Executing clearUseLazyLoad() results in an execution of setLazyLoad(false)

    Image type support! This interface accepts all types of images as specified by MimeTypeUtil.isImageType(String). This means that all such images can loaded and rendered, but note that not all types can be scaled by an ImageScaler.

    Thread Note! The render method is NOT thread safe! If two threads simultaneously executes the render method on the SAME ImageRenderer instance, the rendered result is undeterminable. This is in almost all cases nothing you need to worry about, unless your portlet or servlet actually creates a separate Thread and starts it. If so - ensure all your created threads creates and uses their own ImageRenderer instance!

    Note/Tip! This interface helps rendering images. If you want to render linked images, you would typically use the ImageLinkRenderer instead.

    An instance of the Sitevision class implementing this interface can be obtained via Utils.getImageRenderer(). See Utils for how to obtain an instance of the Utils interface.

    Since:
    Sitevision 2.6.1_08
    Author:
    Magnus Lövgren

    • Method Detail

      • setImageScaler

        void setImageScaler(ImageScaler anImageScaler)
        Sets the image scaler that should be used by the renderer if useImageScaler is true.

        An image scaler is obtained via Utils.getImageScaler(int, int)

        Parameters:
        anImageScaler - the image scaler that can be used by the renderer to create scaled images

      • clearImageScaler

        void clearImageScaler()
        Removes the image scaler, i.e. executes setImageScaler(null)
        See Also:
        setImageScaler(ImageScaler)

      • isImageScalerLoaded

        boolean isImageScalerLoaded()
        Whether or not an image scaler is loaded.
        Returns:
        true if an image scaler is loaded, false if not.

      • setUseImageScaler

        void setUseImageScaler(boolean useImageScaler)
        Decides if an image scaler should be used or not.

        Default is true.

        Parameters:
        useImageScaler - decides if an image scaler should be used or not. If true, an image scaler will be used if it is set. If false, no image scaler will be used even if it is set.

      • forceUseImageScaler

        void forceUseImageScaler()
        Utility method for executing setUseImageScaler(true)
        See Also:
        setUseImageScaler(boolean)

      • clearUseImageScaler

        void clearUseImageScaler()
        Utility method for executing setUseImageScaler(false)
        See Also:
        setUseImageScaler(boolean)

      • setHoverImage

        void setHoverImage(Node anImageNode)
        Sets a hover image that will be activated on the onmouseover javascript event.
        Parameters:
        anImageNode - the hover image (a node with primary node type sv:image)

      • clearHoverImage

        void clearHoverImage()
        Utility method for executing setHoverImage(null)
        See Also:
        setHoverImage(javax.jcr.Node)

      • isHoverImageLoaded

        boolean isHoverImageLoaded()
        Whether or not a hover image is loaded.
        Returns:
        true if a hover image node is loaded, false if not.

      • setImage

        void setImage(Node anImageNode)
        Sets the image to be rendered.

        If anImageNode is not a proper image, the image will be considered as null, i.e. the renderer will not have any image in subsequent render execution.

        Parameters:
        anImageNode - the image (a node with primary node type sv:image)

      • update

        void update(Node anImageNode)
        Updates the renderer with a new image. The description will be removed.

        If anImageNode is not a proper image, the image will be considered as null, i.e. the renderer will not have any image in subsequent render execution.

        Parameters:
        anImageNode - the image (a node with primary node type sv:image)

      • update

        void update(Node anImageNode,
            String aDescription)
        Updates the renderer with a new image and a new description.

        If anImageNode is not a proper image, the image will be considered as null, i.e. the renderer will not have any image in subsequent render execution.

        Parameters:
        anImageNode - the image (a node with primary node type sv:image)
        aDescription - an image description, or null to clear any previous description

      • isImageLoaded

        boolean isImageLoaded()
        Whether or not an image is loaded.
        Returns:
        true if an image node is loaded, false if not.

      • setUseAutoDescription

        void setUseAutoDescription(boolean useAutoDescription)
        A description fallback strategy that makes it possible to render a description value even if no description has been set. When autoDescription is enabled, the renderer will try to use the image description metadata if no description is set.

        Default is false.

        Parameters:
        useAutoDescription - whether or not the renderer should try to get a description via metadata if no description is set

      • forceUseAutoDescription

        void forceUseAutoDescription()
        Utility method for executing setUseAutoDescription(true)
        See Also:
        setUseAutoDescription(boolean)

        Utility method for executing setUseAutoDescription(false)
        See Also:
        setUseAutoDescription(boolean)

        Default is SourceSetMode.AUTO.

        Parameters:

      • setUseTitleRendering

        void setUseTitleRendering(boolean useTitleRendering)
        A title strategy that makes it possible to render a title attribute with the description as value. If titleRendering is disabled, no title attribute will be rendered at all. If titleRendering is enabled, the renderer will always render a title attribute and the descripton will be used as value.

        Default is false.

        Parameters:
        useTitleRendering - whether or not a title attribute should be rendered
        Since:
        Sitevision 2.6.2_04
        See Also:
        setUseAutoTitle(boolean)

      • forceUseTitleRendering

        void forceUseTitleRendering()
        Utility method for executing setUseTitleRendering(true)
        Since:
        Sitevision 2.6.2_04
        See Also:
        setUseTitleRendering(boolean)

      • clearUseTitleRendering

        void clearUseTitleRendering()
        Utility method for executing setUseTitleRendering(false)
        Since:
        Sitevision 2.6.2_04
        See Also:
        setUseTitleRendering(boolean)

      • setUseAutoTitle

        void setUseAutoTitle(boolean useAutoTitle)
        A title fallback strategy that makes it possible to render a title value even if no description is available. When autoTitle is enabled, the renderer will try to use the image description metadata as title value if no description is available.

        Default is false.

        Note! This setting would typically be activated only if the title should be rendered (useTitleRendering is true) and the autoDescription is not activated (useAutoDescription is false). Remember - the title value is always the description, so any other cases than previously stated won't actually add anything new to your code/output...

        Parameters:
        useAutoTitle - whether or not the renderer should try to get a description via metadata to use as title value if no description is available
        Since:
        Sitevision 2.6.2_04
        See Also:
        setUseTitleRendering(boolean)

      • forceUseAutoTitle

        void forceUseAutoTitle()
        Utility method for executing setUseAutoTitle(true)
        Since:
        Sitevision 2.6.2_04
        See Also:
        setUseAutoTitle(boolean)

      • clearUseAutoTitle

        void clearUseAutoTitle()
        Utility method for executing setUseAutoTitle(false)
        Since:
        Sitevision 2.6.2_04
        See Also:
        setUseAutoTitle(boolean)

      • setDescription

        void setDescription(String aDescription)
        Sets the image description (alt attribute on the img element). If there are no description (i.e. description is null) when the result is rendered, an empty alt attribute will be rendered unless the useAutoDescription feature is active (see setUseAutoDescription(boolean)).

        Default is null.

        Parameters:
        aDescription - an alternative description of the image

      • clearDescription

        void clearDescription()
        Removes the description, i.e. executes setDescription(null)
        See Also:
        setDescription(String)

      • setStyle

        void setStyle(String aStyle)
        Sets the style (style attribute on the img element). If there are no style (i.e. style is null) when the result is rendered, no style attribute will be rendered

        Default is border:none.

        Parameters:
        aStyle - the style of the rendered element
        Since:
        Sitevision 2.6.1_10

      • clearStyle

        void clearStyle()
        Removes the style, i.e. executes setStyle(null)
        Since:
        Sitevision 2.6.1_10
        See Also:
        setStyle(String)

      • setUseEncoding

        void setUseEncoding(boolean performEncoding)
        Sets whether or not descriptions should be encoded.

        Default is true.

        Parameters:
        performEncoding - whether descriptions should be encoded or not.

      • forceUseEncoding

        void forceUseEncoding()
        Utility method for executing setUseEncoding(true)
        See Also:
        setUseEncoding(boolean)

      • clearUseEncoding

        void clearUseEncoding()
        Utility method for executing setUseEncoding(false)
        See Also:
        setUseEncoding(boolean)

      • setLazyLoad

        void setLazyLoad(boolean aLazyLoad)
        Sets whether or not the image should be lazy loaded (loaded when it appears in the browser's viewport).

        Note! Lazy loading depends on JavaScript being enabled. Be sure to include an img in a noscript-tag for non JavaScript users.

        Default is false.

        Parameters:
        aLazyLoad - whether the image should be lazy loaded.
        Since:
        Sitevision 5.0

      • forceUseLazyLoad

        void forceUseLazyLoad()
        Utility method for executing setLazyLoad(true)
        Since:
        Sitevision 5.0
        See Also:
        setLazyLoad(boolean)

      • clearUseLazyLoad

        void clearUseLazyLoad()
        Utility method for executing setLazyLoad(false)
        Since:
        Sitevision 5.0
        See Also:
        setLazyLoad(boolean)

      • addDataAttribute

        void addDataAttribute(String aName,
                      String aValue)
        Adds an HTML5 data-* attribute to the image element. Data attributes are optional when the result is rendered. Default is no data attributes.

        There can only be one data attribute per name (i.e. when a data attribute is added it will always replace the possibly existing data attribute that already use that name).

        Notes about names and values:

        • A name that is null or whitespace-only will be completely ignored, i.e. no data attribute will be rendered.
        • A name that isn't properly prefixed with "data-" will be prefixed when the data attribute is rendered.
        • A value that is null or whitespace-only will be rendered as a data attribute without value.
        • A value should not be escaped/encoded. The useEncoding attribute will determine what to do when the data attributes are rendered.
        Parameters:
        aName - the name of the data attribute
        aValue - the value of the data attribute
        Since:
        Sitevision 2023.02.1

      • clearDataAttributes

        void clearDataAttributes()
        Removes all existing data attributes
        Since:
        Sitevision 2023.02.1

      • addAriaAttribute

        void addAriaAttribute(String aName,
                      String aValue)
        Adds an aria-* attribute to the image element. Aria attributes are optional when the result is rendered. Default is no aria attributes.

        There can only be one aria attribute per name (i.e. when an aria attribute is added it will always replace the possibly existing aria attribute that already use that name).

        Notes about names and values:

        • A name that is null or whitespace-only will be completely ignored, i.e. no aria attribute will be rendered.
        • A name that isn't properly prefixed with "aria-" will be prefixed when the aria attribute is rendered.
        • A value that is null or whitespace-only will be rendered as an aria attribute without value.
        • A value should not be escaped/encoded. The useEncoding attribute will determine what to do when the aria attributes are rendered.
        Parameters:
        aName - the name of the aria attribute
        aValue - the value of the aria attribute
        Since:
        Sitevision 2023.02.1

      • clearAriaAttributes

        void clearAriaAttributes()
        Removes all existing aria attributes
        Since:
        Sitevision 2023.02.1

      • addCssClass

        void addCssClass(String aClassName)
        Adds a css class to the class attribute for the image element.

        Notes about css classes:

        • A class that is null or whitespace-only will be completely ignored, i.e. no css class will be added to the class attribute.
        Parameters:
        aClassName - the name of the css class
        Since:
        Sitevision 2023.02.1

      • clearCssClasses

        void clearCssClasses()
        Removes all existing css classes
        Since:
        Sitevision 2023.02.1

      • render

        String render()
        Builds a html img element based on current state.

        Note! The render method is not thread safe (see thread note above) and not all image types can be rendered when using an image scaler (see image support note above).

        Returns:
        if the renderer has a loaded image a html img element, ready to print out on a page, will be returned. If there are no image to render or rendering fails, an empty string will be returned.

Sitevision - Portal and Content Management Made Easy
Sitevision is an advanced Java enterprise portal product and a portlet container (JSR 286) that implements Java Content Repository (JSR 283).
